description:
* Rockus ABC's is a fun way to entertain young children while educating them about the letters of the English alphabet.  It is similar to Rockus Animals, except it teaches about letters instead of animals.  There are two modes to choose from.  Browse mode is a standard flash card system, displaying a full screen image of a letter and an object that starts with that letter while the letter's name, sound, or both is spoken.   Which audio gets played can be set in preferences, as can the case of the letter (upper, lower, both).  To hear the sound again, simply tap the screen, or swipe left or right to change letters.  Challenge mode involves selecting which letter was heard from four displayed images.  Both modes have many optional settings such as: disable gestures, which if on means you must type "back" or "end" to exit Browse or Challenge scenes;  Auto-advancing Browse mode to entertain the really young toddlers and babies; Browsing alphabetically or randomly; Tap advancing to next letter; or automatically replay audio in challenge mode, to name a few.  We plan to continue to add options to the app, as well as make any improvements we can.  If you have any ideas for improvements, or other comments and concerns, please send them 
to support@rockus-studios.com.  If you like this app, be sure to check out Rockus Animals, a similar app with an animal sound focus.
